section.name: Overview
section.p: The display tag library is an open source suite of custom tags that provide high level web presentation patterns which will work in an MVC model. The library provides a significant amount of functionality while still being simple and straight-forward to use.

p.p: Problems and whishes reported against the previous displaytag release are now tracked in the Displaytag Jira Tracker at Codehaus.
The current development is focused on removing some limitations and design flaws who often affected users. Some example?

ul.li: Do you want to add a new export type? You can now do that, it will be configurable! (and a PDF export sample has also been added)
Do you want to easily i18n displaytag properties? Yes, displaytag will support it, and you also can configure the way Locale is choosen.
Do you want to use i18n in column titles in the non-EL version of the taglib, or use an i18n support other than jstl? You will be free to plug-in your own I18nResourceProvider !

p.p:
A
roadmap
is available on Jira, where issues are scheduled and prioritized. (Login is required, you are free to create an account).

p.strong: This documentation is related to the latest development snapshot (unreleased version). Refers to the documentation included in your download if you are using a previous release.

section.name: What can I do with it?
section.p: Actually the display tag library can just... display tables! Give it a list of objects and it will handle column display, sorting, paging, cropping, grouping, exporting, smart linking and decoration of the table in a nice and customizable xhtml style.
